title: Analytics and Reporting in Hiver
content:
Hiver's analytics help you track team performance and identify improvement opportunities.

Accessing Analytics:
1. Click 'Analytics' in the left sidebar
2. Select date range for your report
3. Choose specific shared mailboxes to analyze
4. Filter by team members, tags, or other criteria

Key Metrics:

1. Response Time Metrics:
   - First Response Time: Time to first reply
   - Average Response Time: Mean time for all responses
   - Resolution Time: Time to close conversations

2. Volume Metrics:
   - Total emails received
   - Emails closed
   - Emails pending
   - New vs. returning conversations

3. Team Performance:
   - Emails handled per team member
   - Individual response times
   - Workload distribution
   - CSAT scores by agent

4. CSAT Metrics:
   - Overall satisfaction score
   - Response rate
   - Trend over time
   - Scores by category or tag

Report Types:

1. Overview Dashboard:
   - High-level summary of all metrics
   - Trend charts and comparisons
   - Quick insights at a glance

2. Detailed Reports:
   - Email-level data
   - Exportable to CSV
   - Custom date ranges
   - Filterable by multiple dimensions

3. Scheduled Reports:
   - Automated email delivery
   - Daily, weekly, or monthly
   - Customizable recipients
   - PDF or CSV format

Using Analytics Effectively:
- Set baseline metrics for your team
- Track trends over time, not just snapshots
- Compare performance across team members
- Identify peak hours and adjust staffing
- Use CSAT feedback to improve processes
- Export data for deeper analysis

Common Analysis Scenarios:
- Identifying bottlenecks in response workflow
- Evaluating automation effectiveness
- Determining optimal team size
- Tracking improvement after training
- Justifying resource allocation

Tips:
- Review analytics weekly with your team
- Set realistic, data-driven goals
- Celebrate improvements and wins
- Use insights to refine automations
- Don't obsess over metricsâ€”balance with quality
